url: http://192.168.8.1/api/net/net-mode Method: POST request: Code: <request> <NetworkMode>00</NetworkMode> <NetworkBand>3FFFFFFF</NetworkBand> <LTEBand>800C5</LTEBand> </request>
answer: Code: <Response>OK</response>
Remarks: NetworkMode: 00 - automatically (all networks) 01 - only 2G 02 - only 3G 03 - Only 4G (LTE) 99 - no changes Network mode can be connected such as '0302' is equivalent to 'Preferred LTE -> 3G'
NetworkBand: 80 - GSM1800 300 - GSM900 80000 - GSM850 200000 - GSM1900 400000 - UMTS B1 (2100) 800000 - UMTS B2 (1900) 4000000 - UMTS B5 (850) 2000000000000 - UMTS B8 (900) 1 - BC0A 2 - BC0B 4 - BC1 8 - BC2 10 - BC3 20 - BC4 40 - BC5 400 - BC6 800 - BC7 1000 - BC8 2000 - Bc9 4000 - BC10 8000 - BC11 10000000 - BC12 20000000 - BC13 80000000 - BC14 3FFFFFFF - all supported another is the sum of hexadecimal notation that network (eg. GSM900 + UMTS B8 = 0x2000000000000 + 0x300 = 0x2000000000300)
LTEBand: 1 - B1 (FDD 2100) 4 - B3 (FDD 1800) 40 - B7 (FDD 2600) 80 - B8 (FDD 900) 80000 - B20 (FDD 800) 2000000000 - B38 (TDD 2600) 8000000000 - B40 (TDD 2300) 800C5 - EU band (LTE Band 1, 3, 7, 8, 20) 800D5 - band EU / Asia / Africa (LTE Band 1, 3, 5, 7, 8, 20) 7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF - all band another is the sum of hexadecimal notation that network

Changing different 802.11 settings for E5786/E5186 (and possibly all other Huawei Hilink devices, which support WIFI) url: http://192.168.8.1/api/wlan/multi-basic-settings Method: POST request: Code: <request> <Ssids> <Ssid> <Index>0</Index> <WifiEnable>1</WifiEnable> <WifiSsid>MySSID</WifiSsid> <WifiMac></WifiMac> <WifiBroadcast>0</WifiBroadcast> <WifiIsolate>0</WifiIsolate> <WifiAuthmode>WPA2-PSK</WifiAuthmode> <WifiBasicencryptionmodes>WEP</WifiBasicencryptionmodes> <WifiWpaencryptionmodes>AES</WifiWpaencryptionmodes> <WifiWepKey1></WifiWepKey1> <WifiWepKey2></WifiWepKey2> <WifiWepKey3></WifiWepKey3> <WifiWepKey4></WifiWepKey4> <WifiWep128Key1></WifiWep128Key1> <WifiWep128Key2></WifiWep128Key2> <WifiWep128Key3></WifiWep128Key3> <WifiWep128Key4></WifiWep128Key4> <WifiWepKeyIndex>1</WifiWepKeyIndex> <WifiWpapsk>mysecurepassword</WifiWpapsk> <MixWifiWpapsk>mysecurepassword</MixWifiWpapsk> <WifiWpsenbl>1</WifiWpsenbl> <WifiWpscfg>0</WifiWpscfg> <WifiRotationInterval>60</WifiRotationInterval> <WifiAssociatedStationNum>1</WifiAssociatedStationNum> <wifitotalswitch>1</wifitotalswitch> </Ssid> </Ssids> <WifiRestart>0</WifiRestart> </request>
Remarks: WifiEnable: Values: -) 0 - Enable WIFI -) 1 - Disable WIFI
WifiSsid: Sets the devices WIFI SSID Values: -) a-zA-Z0-1
WifiAuthmode: Values: -) WEP (plz do not use it!) -) WPA-PSK -) WPA2-PSK
WifiWpaencryptionmodes: Values: -) TKIP -) AES (Use this if you wan't full speed @WIFI)
WifiWpapsk: Defines the pre-shared key to get access to your wifi Values: -) a-zA-Z0-9
WifiWpsenbl: Value: -) 0 - Disable WPS -) 1 - Enable WPS
wifirestart: Should be always set to 1, so that the device reboots automatically after sending the request to apply all the settings. Value: -) 0 - Do not reboot device (Settings are NOT applied!) -) 1 - Reboot Deviceto apply settings
answer: Code: <Response>OK</response>

Changing different 802.11 settings for E5786/E5186 (and possibly all other Huawei Hilink devices, which support WIFI) url: http://192.168.8.1/api/wlan/multi-security-settings Method: POST request: Code: <request> <WifiIsolationBetween>0</WifiIsolationBetween> <WifiChannel>0</WifiChannel> <WifiCountry>AT</WifiCountry> <WifiRate>0</WifiRate> <WifiMode>a/n/ac</WifiMode> <WifiMaxAssoc>10</WifiMaxAssoc> <Wifioffenable>1</Wifioffenable> <Wifiofftime>1200</Wifiofftime> <wifibandwidth>80</wifibandwidth> <wifiantennanum>2</wifiantennanum> <wifiautocountryswitch>1</wifiautocountryswitch> <wificountrysupport5g>1</wificountrysupport5g> <WifiRestart>1</WifiRestart> </request>
Remarks: Wifi Channel Values: Select your desired WIFI Channel Value:0 (Default Channel) Values 1 - 14: For 2.4GHZ WIFI Values 7 - 196: For 4GHZ WIFI Wifi Mode: Values: -) a -) a/n -) a/n/ac
WifiMaxAssoc: Defines how many devices are able to connect to the WIFI
WifiOffenable: Defines if the WIFI is turned of, after a certain time Values: -) 1 - Wifi is turned off after a certain time -) 0 - Wifi is NOT turned off after a certain time
Wifiofftime: Sets the treshold after which amount of time, the wifi is turned off automatically. If this value is set, the option "WifiOffenable" has also be set to 1! Values: -) Time in Seconds after the WIFI should be turned off, in case of inactivity.
Wifibandwidth: Sets the wifibandwidth Values: -) 20 - 20MHZ Bandwitdth allows up to 150MBit/s second with WIFI Mode set to N -) 40 - 40MHZ Bandwitdth allows up to 300MBit/s second with WIFI Mode set to N -) 80 - 80MHZ Bandwitdth allows up to 876MBit/s second with WIFI Mode set to a/n/ac
wificountrysupport5g: Should be always set to 1, otherwise 5GHZ WIFI wont work, and only 2.4GHZ is enabled.
wifirestart: Should be always set to 1, so that the device reboots automatically after sending the request to apply all the settings. answer: Code: <Response>OK</response>
